sentences.sContent: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.sCn: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.sContent: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.sCn: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.sContent: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.sCn: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.sContent: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.sCn: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

sentences.sContent: ...A friend recently took her mother to visit an expensive assisted living/nursing home near my town...
...Agricultural workers in green tea fields near Mt...
...how about the French restaurant near the KFC...
...Fast-food firms may not be able to cope with pressures from food regulation in the near future...
...Display and sales restrictions: California has a rule prohibiting alcohol displays near the cash registers in gas stations...
...A recent Harris poll revealed that 79% of Americans say they enjoy cooking and 30% "love it" ; 14% admit to not enjoying kitchen work and just 7% won't go near the stove at all...
...Display and sales restrictions: California has a rule prohibiting alcohol displays near the cash registers in gas stations...
...What did Mclaughlin do on June 7th near the edge of the company’s parking lot...
...Mclaughlin once again demonstrated his carelessness by knocking down several mail boxes near the edge of the company’s parking lot...

phrases.pCn: 走进；险些；可与…相比（多用于否定句）

trans.tranOther: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something
